segments.text: What are you reading about in that science magazine ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There are several interesting articles on recent scientific breakthroughs . I just finished reading one about cloning .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ m not sure I like the idea of that . I don ’ t want people copying me or other people . It could be very confusing .

segments.text: According to the article , you have no real need to worry . Research nowadays is focussing on cloning parts of a human body to replace damaged or lost parts , not on recreating a whole human .

segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: In this article , scientists say that if you took the genes from someone and tried to create a copy of a person , there ’ s no guarantee that the copy would look or act like the original !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I read about how scientists are using material from plants and animals to create new medicines . For example , an animal be immune to disease that affects human . So , scientists find out why it ’ s immune
segments.speaker: S2
